current-chamber.#text: IN THE SENATE OF THE UNITED STATES

official-title.#text:
To authorize the exploration, leasing, development, and production of oil and gas in and from the
			 western portion of the Coastal Plain of the State of Alaska without
			 surface occupancy, and for other purposes.

sponsor.#tail: introduced the following bill; which was read twice and referred to the

term.#tail:
means that area
			 of the Coastal Plain—

text.#text: The term

that borders the
			 land of the State of Alaska to the west and State of Alaska offshore
			 waters of
			 the Beaufort Sea on the north; and

from which oil and gas can be
			 produced through the use of horizontal drilling or other subsurface
			 technology
			 from sites outside or underneath the surface of the Coastal Plain.

header.#text:
Leasing program
			 for land within the Western Coastal Plain

text.#text:
There
			 is authorized the exploration, leasing, development, and production of oil
			 and
			 gas from the Western Coastal Plain.

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: shall take such actions as are necessary—

text.#text: The

to establish and
			 implement, in accordance with this Act, a competitive oil and gas leasing
			 program that will result in an environmentally sound program for the
			 exploration, development, and production of the oil and gas resources of
			 the
			 Western Coastal Plain; and

to administer
			 this Act through regulations, lease terms, conditions, restrictions,
			 prohibitions, stipulations, and other provisions that—

ensure the oil
			 and gas exploration, development, and production activities on the Western
			 Coastal Plain will result in no significant adverse effect on fish and
			 wildlife, fish and wildlife habitat, subsistence resources, and the
			 environment;

prohibit surface
			 occupancy of the Western Coastal Plain during oil and gas development and
			 production; and

require the
			 application of the best commercially available technology for oil and gas
			 exploration, development, and production to all exploration, development,
			 and
			 production operations under this Act in a manner that ensures the receipt
			 of
			 fair market value by the public for the mineral resources to be leased.

header.#text:
Compliance with
			 requirements under certain other laws

text.#text:
For

the oil and gas preleasing and 
			 leasing program and activities authorized by this section in the Western
			 Coastal Plain shall be considered to be compatible with the purposes for
			 which
			 the Arctic National Wildlife Refuge was established; and

no further
			 findings or decisions shall be required to implement that program and
			 those
			 activities.

to

text.#text:
Nothing in this Act expands or limits

text.#text: The

header.#text: Federal and State distribution of revenues

text.#text:
Notwithstanding any other provision of law, of the amount of bonus, rental, and royalty revenues
			 from oil and gas leasing and operations authorized by this Act—
50 percent shall be paid to the State of Alaska; and
the balance shall be deposited in the Treasury of the United States.
Payments to the State of Alaska under this section shall be made on a monthly basis.

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: shall—
